revised_title: Investigations on the Core and Wing Effects in Fluorescent Excitation of Mercury
tldr: The author investigates the fluorescent excitation of mercury using resonance frequency and lower frequencies. They discovered that the core effect, excited by the atomic resonance line, is extinguished by a trace of hydrogen, while the wing effect, caused by molecular or quasi-molecular absorption, can tolerate any amount of hydrogen. This distinction confirms the difference between the core and wing effects and supports the connection between the core effect and atomic absorption.
